title: Berserker helm

It can be purchased from Skulgrimen's Battle Gear shop in Rellekka for 78,000 coins. It's also a possible reward from Barbarian Assault High Gambles.

Item ID3751

The berserker helm is a mid-levelled melee-based helmet. Players must have level 45 Defence and also have completed the quest The Fremennik Trials in order to wear it. It can be purchased from Skulgrimen's Battle Gear shop in Rellekka for 78,000 coins. It's also a possible reward from Barbarian Assault High Gambles.

This helmet is favoured among combat pures for being the lowest level headgear to offer a Strength bonus, which offers the same strength bonus as a helm of Neitiznot and an Obsidian helmet.

The berserker helm's defensive bonuses are roughly on par with the rune full helm. More specifically, the berserker helm is slightly better than the rune full helm in both stab and crush defence, but is slightly worse in slash defence.

Skulgrimen's Battle Gear will buy this helmet from a player for 42,000 coins, making it more beneficial to sell them back than to use high alchemy on them for money.

[[File:Berserker helm chathead.png|left]]
The '''berserker helm''' is a mid-levelled melee-based helmet. Players must have level 45 [[Defence]] and also have completed the quest [[The Fremennik Trials]] in order to wear it. It can be purchased from [[Skulgrimen's Battle Gear]] shop in [[Rellekka]] for 78,000 coins. It's also a possible reward from [[Barbarian Assault]] [[Barbarian Assault/Rewards#High gambles|High Gambles]].

This helmet is favoured among [[combat pure]]s for being the lowest level headgear to offer a [[Strength]] bonus, which offers the same strength bonus as a [[helm of Neitiznot]] and an [[Obsidian helmet]].

The berserker helm's defensive bonuses are roughly on par with the [[rune full helm]]. More specifically, the berserker helm is slightly better than the rune full helm in both stab and crush defence, but is slightly worse in slash defence.

[[Skulgrimen's Battle Gear]] will buy this helmet from a player for 42,000 coins, making it more beneficial to sell them back than to use [[high alchemy]] on them for money.
